Welcome to Balu’s documentation!¶

Balu-python implementation of Balu Toolbox by Domingo Mery (http://dmery.ing.puc.cl/index.php/balu/) in python programming language.

Every Balu function has its own documentation with description and examples. Just use the function “”help”” in python to get a description of how the balu command works:

>> from balu.Classification import Bcl_svm
>> help(Bcl_svm)

Installation¶

Dependencies¶

  • numpy >= 1.11.2
  • scipy >= 0.18.1
  • matplotlib >= 1.5.2
  • scikit-image >= 0.12.3
  • scikit-learn >= 0.18

Mac OS¶

Download and install pip if you haven’t:

  • curl https://bootstrap.pypa.io/ez_setup.py -o - | sudo python
  • sudo easy_install pip

Usually, if you use virtual environment step (1) is not required.

Install balu-python using pip:

  • pip install balu

Linux¶

NOTES¶

We recommend to use a virtual environment to isolate the library from the system installed packages. If you use a virtual environment it is recommended to run in python the command matplotlib.use(‘TkAgg’) before importing any function from matplotlib.pyplot. See here

Package structure¶

  • balu package
    • Subpackages
      • balu.Classification package
      • balu.DataSelectionAndGeneration package
      • balu.FeatureAnalysis package
      • balu.FeatureExtraction package
      • balu.FeatureSelection package
      • balu.FeatureTransformation package
      • balu.ImageProcessing package
      • balu.ImagesAndData package
      • balu.InputOutput package
      • balu.PerformanceEvaluation package
    • Module contents
